title: Mordekaiser's W shouldn't target the nearest ally unless the cast time when not self-cast is removed
body:
So it looks like on the PBE Mordekaiser's Creeping Death was changed to target the nearest allied champion if self-cast. The problem with this is, right now, you can cast it on yourself instantly (no cast time or action interruption), while if it does select a target, there is a brief animation throwing the metal shards on an ally.

While this change is nice if you cast it on yourself by accident, removing the ability to instantly cast the spell is a huge downside in my opinion. It'd be a lot better if the cast time was outright removed.

replies.body: We're on a similar same page - Creeping Death's being changed to be instant cast on allies as well, not just on Morde himself.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aL3jkI9E,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-04-14T03:59:38.358+0000)
>
> We're on a similar same page - Creeping Death's being changed to be instant cast on allies as well, not just on Morde himself.

Have you guys considered allowing Galio's W to work like Morde/Nunu W? Casts it on self if he casts it on an Ally. Same with Annie's Molten Shield too. Possibly even Kayle's W/R.

I'd expect we'd need to cut significant power from those champions somewhere if making those effects self+ally, Kayle's ult especially. In Morde's case we felt it was the appropriate call, given we wanted to add some power to him and he offered no team utility at all outside of his ghost. Those three are in reasonable (or reasonable ish at least) spots balance wise by contrast and bring significant utility already.

Is he still in need of more power? 

I was thinking it'd be cool if you could also cast his shield on enemies. It wouldn't dot the enemy it was was on, but they it damage their allies. It could reduce their mr/armor by (half?) the amount Mord gains, and they could lose movement speed while running away from him. (While he would still gain movement speed while running towards them.) It would literally be a creeping death as they tried to run.

Though this is turning him into more of a Master of Magnetism and not Metal.

I disagree.

For Annie, it is her only defensive ability, but think if she could put it on another Champions. It gives the target 50 MR/Armor and adds on-hit damage back to attackers, similar to Thornmail.

For the stats alone, putting that on another Carry could really tilt the scales. What about a tank? drop that on Rammus before he taunts someone with his W. Ouch..

I mean I think in a lost of cases it wouldn't be that game breaking but it would need to be looked at pretty closely.

For Galio, it depends on how the Shields worked. Each successive hit heals him for less. 20% less, specifically. But if *each* Shield had its own independent tracking than he'd actually get significantly more healing.

Ex. Galio and Ally both get hit 2 times (just for easy math)

If it diminishes together, then it'd be: 85 (galio) + 68 (ally) + 54 (galio) + 44 (ally) = 251
If it diminishes separately, it would be: 85 + 85 + 68 + 68 = 306

This isn't factoring in the AP ratio, and only on a small number of hits but the more hits, the greater the difference. So it would actually change his healing, depending on how the shield was coded.
